div.p: INTENSELY AND IMPORTANTLY SKILLFUL OR WISE.
1. The standard word for an unusual promising ability to perform important future tasks of any kind is cái 才／材, and the talents referred to by this word do not need to be of a "higher" kind.

2. Xián 賢 (ant. bù xiào 不肖 "untalented") often refers to realised talents, and typically includes the nuance of moral worthiness in addition to practical and intellectual talents, and prototypically these talents include moral ones and are excercised in the service of a ruler. (Note the combination 忠賢 "loyal and worthy")
3. Dé 德 "political charisma; moral integrity" refers especially to the higher talents of the sage or the sage ruler and may perhaps be usefully compared in this synonym group. See VIRTUE.
經綸 refers specifically to political talent and is marginal in the group.
智慧 refers to intellectual talent and wisdom. See WISE.
first rough draft to identify synonym group members for future analysis, based on CL. 18.11.2003. CH

sense.def: have ability, be competent, be able
regard as talented, regard somebody as having a high capacity

entry.def: Dé 德 "political charisma; moral integrity" refers especially to the higher talents of the sage or the sage ruler and may perhaps be usefully compared in this synonym group. See VIRTUE.

sense.def: superior moral qualities, higher virtues (other than vulgar mundane strength)

entry.def: The standard word for an unusual promising ability to perform important future tasks of any kind is cái 才／材, and the talents referred to by this word do not need to be of a "higher" kind.
The standard word for an unusual promising ability to perform important future tasks of any kind is cái 才／材, and the talents referred to by this word do not need to be of a "higher" kind.

sense.def: important potential; qualifications; professional talents; relevant skills; promising faculties
be talented, be worthy; be promising 才甚 very talented
persons who have important qualifications, professional skills, promising faculties
have the talent to V See FAYAN 21.1 皆諸侯卿相之才 "(Confucius' discioples) all had the talent to become feudal lords and senior ministers"
qualifications; professional talents; relevant skills; promising faculties
men of the talents of an N
those people who have talents for the function N2
be versed in; be strong at

entry.def: Xián 賢 (ant. bù xiào 不肖 "untalented") often refers to realised talents, and typically includes the nuance of moral worthiness in addition to practical and intellectual talents.

sense.def: qualified, worthy person; person of talent and worth (always non-referential?) 尊賢使能
脩養；moral worthiness; moral qualification; moral dignity; talent; moral excellence, moral talent
qualified; dignified; worthy; distinguished, talented; excellent, remarkable
of persons: 有修養；be (the more) worthy; be (the more) qualified; be morally distinguished, be (the more) talented; NB: 孰賢？tends to be "who is THE MORE talented？“ And predicative 賢人 is NOT graded. 甚賢，最賢
be more worthy than; be more distinguished than; be more talented than; be more qualified than
regard as distinguished or talented, regard as worthy; regard as (the most) qualified
be considered as distinguished, qualified, dignified; talented or morally worthy
be qualified for; have talents with respect to something 有所賢
the qualified; men of dignified talent and worth; worthies
qualifications; worthiness; competence, talent (not primarily moral)

entry.def: Ability of the special skill kind> special talent

note.p: This word is very frequent in ZTJ!

sense.def: specialist, expert, ace (see also 作者)

bibl.title: 唐五代語言詞典 Táng Wǔdài yǔyán cídiǎn A Dictionary of the Language of the Tang and Five Dynasties Periods

sense.def: expert, specialist, ace, extraorinarily gifted person (see also 作家)
have many concrete talents; be versatile; be possessed of many concrete abilities
general talent, abilities (including moral talents and professional abilities)
those who have talent > the talented
a person of talent and moral worth
persons of talent (never: CERTAIN PERSONS OF TALENT)
persons of talent, same as 賢才
abstractly: the man of talent and moral worth (at any time and in any place)
those who are possessed of moral worth and talent (at a certain time or in a certain place)
be the worthiest in N; be a worthy on the scale of N, be a worthy of N-class (but contrast 古之賢者)
a worthy; any worthy; any worthies; worthies of any kind
be a worthy, be a person of moral talent; also plural: be persons of moral worth, be worthies
(there was) a certain (presumed identifiable but unspecified)
the more talented one (of the two, or of the set)
men of talent 前脩 "men of talent of bygone times"
come to be of excellent talent
